Discussion Topic

Let's explore a couple of situations to determine if they would be appropriate to implement Emotion Coaching. Based on each situation, identify whether the situation is appropriate for Emotion Coaching.

Scenario 1:

Three-year-old Abbee runs after her ball into the street. Abbee's mother runs quickly after her to carry her off of the road and out of traffic. Abbee's mother is very upset over the situation and doesn't feel like she can talk to Abbee until she calms down. (Probably not appropriate)

Scenario 2:

Four-year-old Miki loves to play with her sister. Today Miki's sister tells her she does not want to play. Miki's feelings are hurt and she begins to cry. She seeks out her father for comfort. (Appropriate)

Scenario 3:

Five-year-old Jeff is sad each time his father leaves for work. This particular morning, Jeff's father is in a hurry and only has a few minutes to spend with Jeff. (Probably not appropriate)

Sample Feedback

Emotion Coaching isnâ€™t designed to be used in every situation. The following situations may be times when Emotion Coaching is not recommended:

  • You are in a hurry or pressed for time.
  • You are not alone with your child.
  • Safety is of immediate concern.
  • You are too upset to be able to be productive.
  • You need to address serious misbehavior.
  • Your child is demonstrating an emotion that does not match the situation.
